parameters.name: businessId
parameters.description:
The business id of the application group to delete. Can delete
            multiple items. If no parameter is given, all application groups
            are removed. Use parameters to narrow the list of application
            groups to be deleted.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Search for application groups having this name. Enclose the search
            value in special character % to filter items containing this
            value. Add % after the search value to filter items starting with this value.
            Add % before the search value to filter items ending with this value.

parameters.name: _forced
parameters.description:
True if the group used in flows is deleted and impacts are managed
            automatically, false if the group used in flows is not deleted.
            Default value is false.

200.description: The application groups were successfully deleted.

400.description: Invalid arguments.

403.description: The user does no have right to deleted application groups.

post.summary: Creates a new application group.
post.description:
The body has the same syntax as GET /applicationgroups
The name of the application group is mandatory. It should be unique, and should not contain the special characters * ; or ,
If no parameter is given, the created application group contains no applications. An application group that contains applications can be created if the business Ids of the applications are given in the 'members' array. Members count is an INTEGER that specifies the number of applications in the group.

Access enforcement always performed (resource is Application_Group, action is Create)

post.summary: Creates a new application.
post.description:
The body has the same syntax as GET/applications.
The name and the host of the application are mandatory.
The name cannot contain the special characters * ; , or '
The host can contain only alphanumerical characters and may include the characters . : - _
If no parameter is given, the created application is not linked to products. You can create an application that is linked to products if the product's business Ids are given.
An application can be linked to an application group at creation if the name of the group is given in the groups section. If the group does not exist, it is created as well.
Several products and groups can be specified.
An application is identified by its name and host. You can create two applications with the same name if their host differs.


Since: FM v1.0
Access enforcement always performed (resource is Application, action is Create)
Access enforcement always performed (resource is Application_Group, action is Create)

get.summary: Retrieves a list of flows.
get.description:
Only the businessId, name, and status are retrieved when _brief=true.
The status refers to the products on which the flow has already been deployed. The code is the status of the flow as a whole. The deployment status for individual products is listed, and is grouped by Deployed, DeployedwithErrors, Deploying.
A flow JSON also contains information about sources, targets, relays, and protocols. When the products in sources or targets are Transfer CFTs, the source/target sections contain a set of properties: transfer properties, file properties and processing scripts.
The relay section contains data specific to each relay. The business id of a relay is given by its position in the flow. The first relay has the business id=1, the second has the business id=2.
Protocols also have business ids that identify their position in the flow. If the flow has relays, the protocol between source and the first relay has the business id=1, the protocol between the first relay and the next entity (relay or target) has the business id=2.
The file transfer direction is from the source, through the relays to the target.
The entity preceding a specific protocol is called a sender, and the one following it is called a receiver.
Each protocol contains a general data section, common to all combinations of sender/receiver products. This section contains information about the selected protocol, the direction (sender or receiver), and protocol-specific data (PESIT, SFTP, HTTP or FTP).
The protocol section also contains information about each sender/receiver pair.
From a transfer initiator perspective, a product can have the role of client or server. The client is the product initiating the transfer and the server is the product with which the client is communicating directly via the selected protocol. For example, if a flow has a relay and in the source-relay protocol sender pushes files, a product in a source application is the initiator and thus client. The relay product in this case is the server.
In order to know how to handle a transfer, each product has pairs of client and server communication profiles. The selected flow JSON lists the protocol definition for a collection of client/server pairs, each containing the client communication profile from one product and the server communication profile from the product with which it communicates.
For more information, see:

  • GET /unmanagedproducts/{businessid}/communicationprofiles
  • GET /products/{businessid}/communicationprofiles
  • GET /partners

For more information regarding the flow source or target properties, check the API flow column in the Transfer CFT corresponding parameters > Flow configuration in Flow Manager and CFTUTIL section from the User Guide.

Access enforcement always performed (resource is Flow, action is View)

post.summary: Creates a flow.
post.description:
Creates a complete or incomplete flow. A complete flow is ready to be deployed. An incomplete flow is a flow where at least one of the flow members is missing, for example the source.
The created flow must adhere to certain rules that are valid in the GUI. All the rules below that apply to sources, also apply to targets.

  • The flow name is mandatory.
  • The defaultIdentifier is mandatory for the PeSIT protocol. Additionally, when the direction is RECEIVER_PULLS_FILE, the field in the sources -> File properties -> Filename is mandatory.
  • A flow may have no source or target. In this case the protocol cannot be set. You can only set the protocol after defining at least one source and a target.
  • Sources are members of the flow and are all of the same type: applications, application groups, or unmanaged products.
  • If you do not define the source properties, the default values are used.
  • processing script files, as well as certificates, are included in the body of the API, encoded in base64.
  • if the protocol is not specified, the flow will have the protocol set to Undefined.
  • if the protocol section contains only general settings, the communication profiles will be set automatically.
  • for each protocol using SSL, a certificate is mandatory.
The recommended workflow is to create a simple flow and then use the dedicated APIs for sources, targets, relays, and protocols to add details.
See GET /flows for the flow syntax.
For more information regarding the flow source or target properties, check the API flow column in the Transfer CFT corresponding parameters > Flow configuration in Flow Manager and CFTUTIL section from the User Guide.

post.summary: Deploys a list of flows.
post.description:
Deployment is only triggered only on the flows that are deployable: SavedNotDeployed or DeployedInError.
If the list of flows to be deployed contain flows that have the status Deployed, Saved, or Deploying, the deploy is not triggered on those flows.
The command response specifies the number of flows on which the deploy was triggered. Deployment continues after the command is reported as successful.
Use the GET /flows command with _brief=true to check the deployments status.
If conflicts with other flows or with legacy flows are detected during the flow deployment and _forcedRestart=true, the deployment is forced on all products. The equivalent in the GUI is an OK to the warning about these conflicts.

put.description:
The protocol, direction, and properties fields are common to all sender/receiver product pairs:

  • Protocol - Can be PESIT, SFTP, HTTP, FTP
  • Direction - Can be sender_pushes_files or reciever_pulls files
  • Properties - Specific to each protocol
    The general properties specific to PeSIT are:
  • securityPorfile: NONE, Mutual_authentication
  • defaultIdentifier: string - the flow identifier from GUI
  • networkProtocol: TCP, PTCP, UDT
The communication profiles for PeSIT are updated automatically, and are not mandatory in this API command.
If the protocol is not supported on some of the products in the flow connected by this protocol, the flow status becomes Saved and there is a warning in the GUI on the flow protocol.
You can use a simplified syntax for A2A flows, which is the result of GET /flows/{businessId}/protocols.

get.summary: Retrieves the sources in a given flow.
get.description:
The data retrieved includes properties common to all sources and an array of properties specific to each source. For example, if the source is an application with several Transfer CFTs, the response contains:

  • type - An application
  • parts - An array of applications, each being contained in a -part- section
  • properties - The transfer properties, file properties, and processing scripts

For more information regarding the flow source or target properties, check the API flow column in the Transfer CFT corresponding parameters > Flow configuration in Flow Manager and CFTUTIL section from the User Guide.

post.summary: Adds a new source to the given flow.
post.description:
Body is required. Products are linked to the new source if they are specified in the body

This command can be used to add a source member, when the flow already contain at least one source member and thus the type and the common properties are already defined.
The JSON syntax differs from the one returned by GET; it has the content of a part added to the parts array. This command cannot change the source type.
Additionally, for PeSIT the properties are common to all sources and are not altered by this command.
It is possible to add a new application and to not link a product to it. To link a product to an application, use a dedicated API command: POST /flows/{businessId}/sources/{sourceId}/products/{productid}
See GET and POST /flows for more information on flow syntax.
For more information regarding the flow source or target properties, check the API flow column in the Transfer CFT corresponding parameters > Flow configuration in Flow Manager and CFTUTIL section from the User Guide.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Search for flow templates having this status. Possible values: SAVED,
            PUBLISHING, PUBLISHED, PUBLISHED_IN_ERROR, UNPUBLISHING, UNPUBLISHED_IN_ERROR

parameters.name: flowPatternName
parameters.description:
Search for flow templates having this flow pattern. Enclose the search value in
            special character % to filter items containing this value.
            Add % after the search value to filter items starting with this value.
            Add % before the search value to filter items ending with this value.

parameters.name: memberType
parameters.description:
Search for flow templates having this member type. Parameter 'memberType'
            can be one of: APPLICATION, PARTNER, HYBRID, CFT or SecureTransport.

parameters.name: memberPosition
parameters.description:
Search for flow templates having this member position. Parameter
            'memberPosition' can be one of: SOURCE, TARGET, RELAY.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description:
Search for flow templates having this protocol in the flow template.
            Protocol can be one of: PESIT, SFTP, FTP, HTTP.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Get flow templates starting from the specified offset
            in the list of records returned by the database.
            If not set, offset defaults to 0. Legal values: 0 <= offset <= 2147483647

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned per request.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort flow templates using a specific field from result record.
            Use in conjunction with 'ascending' parameter.
            Valid values are: name, status, flowPatternName, changeDate, creationDate.
            It defaults to 'changeDate'.

parameters.name: ascending
parameters.description:
Use in conjunction with 'sort' parameter.
            Defaults to 'false' - descending order.
            Sort defaults to 'changeDate' - (if none of 'sort' or 'ascending'
            are set, the latest modified flow templates will be returned first).

parameters.name: _brief
parameters.description:
Flag indicating what properties to be returned. Default value is false
            to return all the properties of the flow template. Use true for just
            the basic properties.

200.description: Body containing the list of filtered flow templates.

400.description:
Invalid offset, limit, sort criteria or invalid status to search for.
                   See swagger documentation for available options.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of partners.
get.description:
Partners contain general information (name, type) and server communication profiles.
Server communication profiles can have the protocol PeSIT, SFTP, FTP or HTTP.
A partner can be used in a flow as source or target. Depending on the direction of the protocol the partner can play the role of client or server. The client initiates the transfer. For example, if the direction of the protocol between source and relay is sender pushes files, the source is initiator and thus is a client. If the direction is receiver pulls files, the client is the relay.
In order to define the client/server communication parameters, a client communication profile and a server communication profile have to be defined for each pair of interacting products in the flow.
In GUI the server communication profiles are defined in the partner.
In GUI the client communication profiles are defined during flow creation.
In APIs client and server communication profiles of a partner are typically handled in the /partners resource. GET /partners retrieves client and server communication profiles associated with each partner.

412.description:
The communication profile update has has an impact on
              flows. To perform the operation regardless of its impact, set
              the _forced parameter to true.

put.description:
The partner communication profile update should follow these rules:

  • If the update body does not contain all the mandatory fields, the operation is rejected.
  • If the update body contains the mandatory fields, but does not contain some of the non-mandatory fields, these fields take the default values from GUI.
  • If the partner already contains a communication profile, and the API partner update body does not contain it, the communication profile is deleted.
  • If enableSSL=true, a certificate should be provided. The certificate is included in the body of the API, encoded in base64 in the parameter certificateContent.
  • The certificateAlias should be unique in the partner.
The mandatory fields for each protocol are:
  • PESIT: host, port, PESIT login
  • FTP: host, port
  • HTTP: URLs or (host and port)
  • SFTP: host, port
For more information, see GET /partners.

parameters.description:

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned per request.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort products using a specific field from result record.

parameters.name: ascending
parameters.description:

get.description:
Retrieves general information related to products as well as their client and server communication profiles.
When a product is registered, client and server communication profiles are created corresponding to the ones existing on the actual product configuration. These communication profiles can be selected when the product is set to act as client or server in a flow. For Transfer CFT, the client and server communication profiles are set automatically in a flow when the protocol is defined.

The communication profile with the given businessId doesn't
              exist.

412.description:
The communication profile update has has an impact on
              flows. To perform the operation regardless of its impact, set
              the _forced parameter to true.

put.description:
The product communication profile update should follow these rules:

  • If the update body does not contain all the mandatory fields, the operation is rejected.
  • If the update body contains the mandatory fields, but does not contain some of the non-mandatory fields, these fields take the default values from GUI.
  • If the product already contains a communication profile, and the API product update body does not contain it, the communication profile is deleted.
  • If enableSSL=true, a certificate should be provided. The certificate is included in the body of the API, encoded in base64 in the parameter certificateContent.
  • The certificateAlias should be unique in the product.
The mandatory fields for each protocol are:
  • PESIT: host, port, PESIT login
  • FTP: host, port
  • HTTP: URLs or (host and port)
  • SFTP: host, port
For more information, see GET /products.

When using a PUT, only the URL ID is taken into account; the ID in the request body is not updated.

nfname.description:
Name of the physical file at the receiver partner site
Max length 512

nkeylen.description:
Length, in bytes, of the indexed file's key
Between 0 and 32767. Default 0

nkeypos.description:
Location, in bytes, of the key in the records of an indexed file
Between 0 and 32767. Default 0

nlrecl.description:
Length of the record of the receiver file
Between 0 and 32767. Default 0

notify.description:
Defines the destination of the messages associated with the send transfer selected from the log file messages, by the value of the OPERMSG parameter
Max length 8
The z/OS, IBM i, and OpenVMS platforms are case insensitive; place the value between double quotes to ensure case sensitivity.

npad.description:
Padding character at the network level
Max length 16

nrecfm.description: File record format defined in protocol terms

nspace.description:
File size, in protocol terms, expressed as a number of blocks of 1 K bytes
Between 0 and 9 999 999 999. Default 0

opermsg.description:
Categories of transfer information messages intended for the operator, with all the messages also being written in the log file
Between 0 and 255. Default 0

parm.description:
User parameter sent to the receiver
Max length 512

postmindate.description:
Post-processing exec file can be launched from this date
Between 0 and 99991231. Default 10000101.

postmintime.description:
Post-processing exec file can be launched from this time
Between 0 and 23595999. Default 0.

poststate.description:
The transfer phase step as it enters the Y phase
Available value : DISP

posttimeout.description:
Timeout before changing the phase step to K if no END is received during post-processing
Between 0 and 3600. Default 0

preexec.description:
The preprocessing exec file
Max length 512
The z/OS, IBM i, and OpenVMS platforms are case insensitive; place the value between double quotes to ensure case sensitivity.

premindate.description:
Execute the preprocessing file as of this date
Between 0 and 99991231. Default 10000101

premintime.description:
Execute the preprocessing file as of this time
Between 0 and 23595999. Default 0

prestate.description: The transfer phase step as it enters the A phase

pretimeout.description:
Timeout before switching phase step to K if no END is received during preprocessing
Between 0 and 3600. Default 0

pri.description:
Priority of scheduled transfers
Between 0 and 255. Default 128

rappl.description:
Identifier of the file receiver application
Max length 48
Case Insensitive, except if value in delimited by double quotes

rpasswd.description: Password for the user who is receiving the file

ruser.description:
Identifier for the user who is receiving the file
Max length 32
Case Insensitive, except if value in delimited by double quotes

sappl.description:
Identifier of the file sender application
Max length 48
Case Insensitive, except if value in delimited by double quotes

selfname.description:
Name of a file that contains a list of files selected for sending
Max length 512

serial.description: Parameter to enable file transfer serialization in flow definitions

sigfname.description:
Name of the signature file
Max length 512

sourceappl.description:
Identifier of the file sender application
Max length 100
Case Insensitive, except if value in delimited by double quotes

spart.description:
Network designation by which the local Transfer CFT identifies itself to its partner
Max length 64

spasswd.description: Password for the user who is sending the file

suser.description:
Identifier for the user who is sending the file
Max length 32
Case Insensitive, except if value in delimited by double quotes

targetappl.description:
Identifier of the local file receiver application
Max length 100
Case Insensitive, except if value in delimited by double quotes

trk.description: Details provided to Sentinel about transfers

userid.description:
Identifier of the transfer owner
Max length 32
The z/OS, IBM i, and OpenVMS platforms are case insensitive; place the value between double quotes to ensure case sensitivity.

wfname.description:
Name of the temporary file used to send a group of files selected in line with the generic name specified in FNAME
Max length 512

xlate.description:
Identifier of the CFTXLATE object defining the translation table used for the transfers
Max length 32

archivedir.description: Absolute path name of the top level directory to archive file

enablesubdir.description: Indicates if the subfolders are also monitored <YES>  ('YES','NO')

excludefilter.description: Files whose names match this pattern are not monitored

filecount.description: Maximum number of file submissions for each scan

fileidledelay.description: If the state of a file has not changed within this delay in seconds, the file becomes a candidate for submission

filesizemax.description: Files larger than this value, in bytes, are not candidates for submission

filesizemin.description: Files shorter than this value, in bytes, are not candidates for submission

filtertype.description: Pattern matching algorithm to use for file name filtering  [<WILDMAT> ('STRJCMP','WILDMAT','EREGEX') for windows and unix]  [<STRJCMP> ('STRJCMP','EREGEX') for others systems]

includefilter.description: Only files whose names match this pattern are monitored

interval.description: Interval in seconds between two scans of the directory files

method.description: Indicates if the files are moved from the scan folder to the work folder or left <MOVE>  ('MOVE','FILE')

renamemethod.description: Adds nothing, or a timestamp of the pattern YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, at the end of the name of the renamed file <TIMESTAMP>  ('NONE','TIMESTAMP')

renameseparator.description: The first character defines the separator before the timestamp. The second character, when present, defines the separator after the timestamp <.>

resubmitchanges.description: Indicates if the changed files must be resubmitted <YES>  ('YES','NO')

scandir.description: Absolute path name of the top level directory to scan.

usefsevents.description: Indicates if file-system events are used to trigger folder scans <NO> ('YES','NO') only available on windows and linux

workdir.description: Absolute path name of the top level directory available for file state information

id.description: The internal id of the parameter

businessId.description: The businessId of the synchronization request
